Articles.Content:
Kerbal Obsessive Grief Syndrome, also known as KOGS, is a disorder often acquired from playing too much Kerbal Space Program.

Common symptoms of KOGS are irregular thought patterns, obsession, borderline schizophrenia, and depression. Some physical symptoms that may take place are an a decrease in weight, blurred vision, and lack of sleep.

It has 4 stages of development before it completely takes effect, and once it does, it can be very hard to reverse. The 4 stages of KOGS have been elaborated on here:

Stage 1: Intrigue

The patient will try the demo of KSP, and get used to its setting and mechanics, specifically the mechanics of lithobraking. this will make the patient intrigued, and make them want more of an experience.

Stage 2: Wonder

The patient will then proceed to buy the full version. The patient is in awe of the new planets to explore, and the new parts at their disposal. The patient makes it their mission to explore and do everything within their ability in this fantastic new game.

Stage 3: Obsession

The patient becomes obsessed with KSP. The patient spends days and nights trying to explore all the interplanetary bodies they are physically able to. The patient often gets little sleep during this time, and forgets to eat, which is met with massive intakes of caffeinated beverages.

Stage 4: Depression

The patient becomes depressed, because they realize that they are eating away at their short life without actually accomplishing anything meaningful. The patient is often not in a very healthy position physically or socially by the time the fourth stage kicks in. The patient will then proceed to try to force these feelings of depression down by playing even more KSP, but it only makes their depression more prominent. This depression eventually turns to grief as the patient realizes that they wasted so much of their life meaninglessly playing KSP, and they will never get it back.

If you are experiencing any of these stages, or have already gone through them all, you should speak up about it. There ARE treatment options for you.

Ehhh...what treatment options?

There are several treatment options for KOGS, but some of them require sacrifice. However, they do work sufficiently well, or at least they worked for me.

Treatment Option 1: Become a KSP Youtuber

This treatment option will solve stage 4, but it may not stop your obsession with KSP. However it will at least show make you feel that your obsession has a sense of purpose, and is giving others enjoyment.

Treatment Option 2: Limit Your KSP Intake

This Treatment option should cure all symptoms of KOGS. For this treatment option, it is best to limit your KSP intake to 2-3 hours per day. This challenge may be quite hard for some, but it will be worth it.

Treatment Option 3: Quit KSP Cold Turkey

NOTE: THIS TREATMENT OPTION CAN BE QUITE DANGEROUS, AND COULD CAUSE IRREVERSABLE MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES. That being said, it is the only way to completely cure all symptoms of KOGS. And the irreversable mental health issues are not really that bad, and they are worth getting your life back.

These treatment options worked for me, so they can probably work for you.
